SEARCH
Package gw.cc.claim.entity

Interface CloseReopenInfo

All Known Subinterfaces:
ClaimCloseReopenInfo, CloseClaimInfo, CloseExposureInfo, CloseMatterInfo, ExpCloseReopenInfo, MatterCloseReopenInfo, ReopenClaimInfo, ReopenExposureInfo, ReopenMatterInfo
public interface CloseReopenInfo
CloseReopenInfo null

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    beforeCommit()
    Called before committing the bundle, takes care of closing or reopening the associated entity.
    void
    commitWithoutExplanation()
    Called when the UI is configured to reopen an entity without prompting the user for any explanation (could also be used for closing an entity, though it isn't in our base configuration).

  • Method Details

    • beforeCommit

      void beforeCommit() throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.CloseException, com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.ReopenException, EntityValidationException
      Called before committing the bundle, takes care of closing or reopening the associated entity. This normally has at least the following parts:
      • Running a set of close/reopen validation rules to make sure the entity can be closed/reopened
      • Calling the close/reopen method of the entity, passing in the note entered by the user as an argument to be stored as a reason (explanation for) the close/reopen
      • Adding the note as an actual Note object
      • Handling validation warnings. If the close/reopen validation rules fail with a warning on the first call of beforeCommit then the second call should succeed, providing only the same warnings are reported
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.CloseException - if there is an error closing the entity. This is a user displayable exception and will just be displayed directly to the user.
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.ReopenException - if there is an error reopening the entity. This is a user displayable exception and will just be displayed directly to the user.
      EntityValidationException - if the close/reopen validation rules report an error or warning

    • commitWithoutExplanation

      void commitWithoutExplanation() throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.CloseException, com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.ReopenException, EntityValidationException
      Called when the UI is configured to reopen an entity without prompting the user for any explanation (could also be used for closing an entity, though it isn't in our base configuration). Reopens/closes the entity by calling beforeCommit() and then commits the bundle, taking care of bundle rollback if there are errors. If there are validation errors then calling this method a second time will override them, providing no new validation errors or warnings have been introduced in the meantime.
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.CloseException - if there is an error closing the entity. This is a user displayable exception and will just be displayed directly to the user.
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.ReopenException - if there is an error reopening the entity. This is a user displayable exception and will just be displayed directly to the user.
      EntityValidationException - if the close/reopen validation rules report an error or warning
